availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Askren (Bracken County and Mason County, Kentucky, cooper and farmer.)

body.p: Bracken County and Mason County, Kentucky, cooper and farmer. Brown County, Ohio, native. Married to Catherine Hughbanks Askren in Bracken County, Kentucky, on November 5, 1854. Father of Elizabeth Askren, William Askren, Frances Askren, Jennie Askren, and Charles Askren. Cooper in Brown County, Ohio, in 1850. Cooper in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Brown County, Lewis Township, p. 449B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 162.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct No. 3, 426A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #12027.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film #000851644.
"John Campbell Askren (1831-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial #68272117, Accessed July 12, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68272117.
